content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia function extract_julia_code(md::AbstractString)

# Import the required packages
using Markdown, Regex

# Define regular expression pattern for code blocks
code_block_pattern = r"^```([\w-]*)\n((?:.|\n)|[^`])+?(?=```[\1]\s|$)"

# Extract all code blocks from the markdown document
code_blocks = matchall(code_block_pattern, md) do m
    String(m.match)
end

# Filter out empty or invalid code blocks
valid_code_blocks = filter(!isempty, code_blocks)

# Join multiple consecutive code blocks with newline character
joined_code_blocks = join(valid_code_blocks, "\n")

# Remove the leading and trailing triple backticks of each code block
extracted_code = replace(joined_code_blocks, r"^```([\w-]*)\n|(?:\n)+```[\1]$", "")

end
```
